solution_line_template: Two pairs of sunglasses costs {number_of_sunglasses_pairs} x ${cost_per_sunglasses_pair} = $<<{number_of_sunglasses_pairs}*{cost_per_sunglasses_pair}={cost_of_sunglasses}>>{cost_of_sunglasses}.
Thus, two decks of basketball cards costs ${mary_total_spent} - ${cost_of_shoes} = $<<{mary_total_spent}-{cost_of_shoes}={cost_of_two_decks}>>{cost_of_two_decks}.
Therefore, one deck of basketball cards costs ${cost_of_two_decks}/{number_of_decks} = $<<{cost_of_two_decks}/{number_of_decks}={cost_of_one_deck}>>{cost_of_one_deck}.
